title: Can we use detergent to remove impurity on clothes or only water? - Assim al hakeem
transcript: yes my question is uh can we not put detergent when washing clothes that have nijasa in the washing machine as the washing machine mixes the water with the detergent so the smell and taste of the water would be changed due to the fail of a soil which is the person that turned on the washing machine and even the name of the water changes to like soapy water thus the clothes we washed like a Tahir water and not the hood so basically farooq's question is can we use detergents when removing a najasa or should it only be removed by water why because when we mix water with detergents soap and the likes and they mix with the soiled clothes the water can't be distinguished and the nature of the water or the characteristics whether it's a smell or taste or color can't be identified whether it was due to najasa or something else so would that prevent the clothes from being purified the answer is no the issue of najasa and removing it the most authentic opinion is that if the Mass
